comment.author: 11226331@N05
comment._content: He has naval service records at The National Archives discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/SearchUI/s/res?_col=onl... The catalogue information shows he was Geoffrey John Tress Bahin, born 29 June 1896. He joined the Royal Navy in September 1914 and subsequently achieved the rank of Commander. Interestingly the catalogue search also picks up naturalisation papers for a Charles Prospere Bahin from France who became a British Subject in 1859.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content:
Born 29 June 1896 in Prestwich, Manchester. GJT was the son of Charles Emile and Elizabeth Maud Bahin. Charles E was a Vicar, born in Taunton, Somerset. In 1911 Charles was a Widower and they lived at 99 Lloyd Street, Greenheys, Manchester with Charles' unmarried sister and a servant.

GJT was described as Student Medical even though he was only aged 14.

He died circa 1971 in Folkestone, Kent.

comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: He was awarded the OBE in 1959 Commander Geoffrey John Tress BAHIN, Royal Navy (Retired), General Secretary, Kent Council of Social Service. www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/41727/supplements/3712/pa...
